intro: Peperomia putlaensis, commonly known as the Mexican peperomia, is a compact, low-growing plant native to Mexico. It features thick, fleshy leaves that are typically dark green with a waxy texture, and it produces small, inconspicuous flowers in clusters. The plant is well adapted to dry conditions, making it drought-tolerant and suitable for indoor cultivation. It prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to thrive. Its unique appearance and ease of care make it a popular choice for collectors and indoor gardeners.
